summary: Medicaid home- and community-based services help beneficiaries with daily activities like bathing, dressing, and eating. To continue services during the pandemic and prevent the spread of COVID-19 , the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) allowed states to make temporary changes like providing more home-delivered meals or giving providers hazard pay. title: Medicaid Home- and Community-Based Services: Evaluating COVID-19 Response Could Help CMS Prepare for Future Emergencies
